subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Vanity Metrics vs. Actionable Metrics
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Vanity Metrics vs. Actionable Metrics.

hook.text: Your app has 100,000 downloads. Investors are excited. But only 200 people used it this week.

buildup.text: Vanity metricsâ€”total users, page views, downloadsâ€”go up and to the right. They always look good.

discovery.text: Actionable metrics answer: did this specific change cause this specific behavior in this group?

twist.text: Ries's startup IMVU had growing revenue but couldn't explain why. Growth turned out to be random noise.

climax.text: They switched to actionable metrics and discovered their marketing wasn't working at all.

punchline.text: A metric that can't change your behavior is just decoration.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between vanity metrics and actionable metrics?
options: Vanity metrics are free to track while actionable metrics require paid tools
Actionable metrics show whether a specific change caused a specific behavior
Vanity metrics are used by startups while actionable metrics are for big companies
